Sentence: For giving me this opportunity I thank Tiffany A. López " who organized the conference “ Revolution & Resistance : The State of Chicana/o Art & Activism at the University of California " Lado del Río in February 2003 I also thank Isabel Durán " Ana Antón-Pacheco and Félix Martín for inviting me to present at the Universidad Complutense of Madrid and also in Victoria ( Spain ) in April 2003 I am grateful to Ksenija Bilbija " who invited me to give two lectures on Argentine and Chicana poetry at the University of Wisconsin–Madison in March 2004 Thanks to her support—and that of Raphael Kadushin—I also perfomed from Killer Crónicas .

EnglishTrans: For giving me this opportunity I thank Tiffany A. SpanishTrans: Por darme esta oportunidad agradezco a Tiffany A. López " quien organizó la conferencia " Revolution & Resistance : The State of Chicana/o Art & Activism en la Universidad de California " Lado del Río en febrero de 2003 También agradezco a Isabel Durán " Ana Antón-Pacheco y Félix Martín por invitarme a presentar en la Universidad Complutense de Madrid y también en Victoria ( España ) en abril de 2003 Agradezco a Ksenija Bilbija " quien me invitó a dar dos conferencias sobre poesía argentina y chicana en la Universidad de Wisconsin-Madison en marzo de 2004 Gracias a su apoyo-y el de Raphael Kadushin-también actué de Killer Crónicas .

Sentence: The thirteen-month sabbatical in Buenos Aires ( 2000–01 ) " partially funded by an NEH fellowship for college teachers " sencillamente me transformó la vida y la escritura .
Tags: Eng Eng Eng Eng NamedEnt NamedEnt Punct Spn Punct Punct Eng Eng Eng Eng NamedEnt Eng Eng Eng Eng Punct Spn Spn Spn Spn Spn Spn Spn Spn
EnglishTrans: The thirteen-month sabbatical in Buenos Aires ( 2000-01 ) " partially funded by an NEH fellowship for college teachers " simply transformed my life and writing.
SpanishTrans: Los trece meses sabáticos en Buenos Aires (2000-01) "parcialmente financiados por una beca de la NEH para profesores universitarios" sencillamente me transformó la vida y la escritura.

Sentence: This fellowship allowed me to realize a dream I’d cherished as a Cortázar-reading teenager " and which grew to the II fever-pitch of an obsession when I began to work on Alejandra Pizarnik as a doctoral student and " later " in my research on contemporary women poets from Buenos Aires : conocer la Argentina .
Tags: Eng Eng Eng Spn Eng Eng Spn Eng Spn Eng Eng Spn Eng Eng Punct Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Spn Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng NamedEnt NamedEnt Eng Spn Spn Eng Eng Punct Eng Punct Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Spn Eng NamedEnt NamedEnt Punct Spn Spn NamedEnt
EnglishTrans: This fellowship allowed me to realize a dream I'd cherished as a Cortázar-reading teenager " and which grew to the II fever-pitch of an obsession when I began to work on Alejandra Pizarnik as a doctoral student and " later " in my research on contemporary women poets from Buenos Aires : knowing Argentina .
SpanishTrans: Esta beca me permitió realizar un sueño que había acariciado como adolescente que leía Cortázar" y que creció hasta convertirse en una obsesión cuando empecé a trabajar en Alejandra Pizarnik como estudiante de doctorado y "más tarde" en mi investigación sobre las mujeres poetas contemporáneas de Buenos Aires: conocer la Argentina.

EnglishTrans: That psuedo-jazzy "Gato Barbieri-ish soundtrack" took me right away to the Nickolodeon Theatre in downtown Santa Cruz "to my fast-ending childhood" when at 17 years old "I think" I went in alone to see "Turkish Delight" which promised to be an "X-rated" movie. "Roll the credits (oh what a prescient and sophisticated girl" I would say later): a film boss Jan de Bont would turn out to be "not to mention Paul Verhoeven himself" with his "Soldier of Orange" "Keetje Tippel" "Spetters" "plus of course "Rollerball" and then...all the action bullshit that would bring him real (read: international" read: USA) fame later.
SpanishTrans: Esa psuedo-jazzy "Gato Barbieri" me retrotrajo enseguida al Teatro Nickolodeon en el centro de Santa Cruz "a mi niñez de rápido final" cuando a los 17 años "creo" entré solo para ver "Turkish Delight" "que prometia ser una pelicula "clasificada X." Pasa los créditos ( oh que chica tan presciente y sofisticada " me diría después ) : un capo de cinematógrafo Jan de Bont resultaría ser "sin mencionar al mismo Paul Verhoeven" con su "Soldado de Orange" "Keetje Tippel" "Spetters" "además de por supuesto "Rollerball" y luego... toda la mierda de acción que le daría verdadera ( léase : internacional " léase : USA ) fama después .

Tags: Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Punct Spn Spn Spn Spn Spn Spn Spn Spn Spn Punct Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Spn Spn Spn Spn Spn Punct Eng Eng Eng
EnglishTrans: Just feet before the ring " the young man stands in the stirrups " standing completely upright one perfect second extends the stick and wham " he has it .
SpanishTrans: Apenas unos pies antes del anillo "el joven se pone de pie en los estribos" parado completamente erguido un segundo perfecto extiende el palo y zas "él lo tiene.

Sentence: El truco is not onlyto get the ring on the stick " but also not to let it fly off ( which it does with disheartening regularity ) and of course " not to fall off the horse .
Tags: Spn Spn Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Punct Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Punct Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Punct Eng Eng Eng Punct Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng
EnglishTrans: The trick is not only to get the ring on the stick " but also not to let it fly off ( which it does with disheartening regularity ) and of course " not to fall off the horse .
SpanishTrans: El truco no es sólo poner la anilla en el palo, sino también no dejar que se salga volando (lo que hace con una regularidad descorazonadora) y, por supuesto, "no caerse del caballo".

Sentence: It is late en la sultry noche porteña de barrio .
Tags: Eng Eng Eng Spn Spn Spn Spn Spn Spn Spn
EnglishTrans: It is late in the sultry night of Buenos Aires.
SpanishTrans: Es tarde en la bochornosa noche porteña de barrio.

Sentence: We begin to walk away " right next to the foam-flecked horses ( they sweat right down to their hooves ; rico el olor ) .
Tags: Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Punct Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Punct Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Punct Spn Spn Spn Punct
EnglishTrans: We begin to walk away " right next to the foam-flecked horses ( they sweat right down to their hooves ; rich smell ) .
SpanishTrans: Comenzamos a alejarnos " justo al lado de los caballos con manchas de espuma ( sudan hasta los cascos ; rico el olor ) .

Sentence: Nos damos cuenta de que la perspectiva desde el comienzo de la carrera es " si cabe " even more thrilling .
Tags: Spn Spn Spn Spn Spn Spn Spn Spn Spn Spn Spn Spn Spn Spn Punct Spn Spn Punct Eng Eng Eng
EnglishTrans: We realize that the perspective from the beginning of the race is "even more thrilling".
SpanishTrans: Nos damos cuenta de que la perspectiva desde el comienzo de la carrera es "si cabe" aún más emocionante.

Sentence: From here " we can sense the anticipation of riders and their mounts ; the horses turn and twitch " reluctant or bored " y los jinetes intentan contenerlos " inspirarlos .
Tags: Eng Eng Punct Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Punct Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Punct Eng Eng Eng Punct Spn Spn Spn Spn Spn Punct Spn
EnglishTrans: From here " we can sense the anticipation of riders and their mounts ; the horses turn and twitch " reluctant or bored " and the riders try to contain them " inspire them .
SpanishTrans: Desde aquí "podemos sentir la anticipación de los jinetes y sus monturas; los caballos giran y se mueven "reacios o aburridos" y los jinetes intentan contenerlos "inspirarlos".

Sentence: They take off like a shot " four legs pumping together " rider crouched down on the haunches and then rising up " some of them " nearly vertical .
Tags: Eng Eng Eng Eng Spn Eng Punct Eng Eng Eng Eng Punct Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Punct Eng Eng Eng Punct Eng Spn
EnglishTrans: They take off like a shot " four legs pumping together " rider crouched down on the haunches and then rising up " some of them " nearly vertical .
SpanishTrans: Despegan como un disparo, "cuatro piernas que se juntan", el jinete se agacha sobre las caderas y luego se eleva, "algunas de ellas", casi verticalmente.

Sentence: Algunos caballos fustigados to within an inch of their lives " it seems—thwackse escucha el crop—mientras otros run like hell " simplemente porque sí .
Tags: Spn Spn Spn Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Punct Eng Eng Spn Spn Spn Spn Eng Eng Eng Punct Spn Spn Spn
EnglishTrans: Some horses whipped to within an inch of their lives "it seems-thwackse listen to the crop- while others run like hell" just because.
SpanishTrans: Algunos caballos fustigados a una pulgada de sus vidas " parece que escucha el cultivo-mientras otros corren como el infierno " simplemente porque sí .

Sentence: No látigo required .
Tags: Spn Spn Eng
EnglishTrans: No whip required .
SpanishTrans: No se requiere látigo.

Sentence: The dancers have moved from chacarera and samba to tango now ; la plaza está más atestada que nunca .
Tags: Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Spn Eng Spn Eng Spn Eng Punct Spn Spn Spn Spn Spn Spn Spn
EnglishTrans: The dancers have moved from chacarera and samba to tango now ; the square is more crowded than ever .
SpanishTrans: Los bailarines han pasado de la chacarera y la samba al tango ahora ; la plaza está más atestada que nunca .

Sentence: The night is152 just beginning para los vecinos de Mataderos " but an hour-long taxi ride awaits us ( thrill of his life pal conservative " father of “ three non-drug taking teens ” taxista que nos ha tocado ) .
Tags: Eng Eng Spn Eng Eng Spn Spn Spn Spn Spn Punct Eng Eng Eng Spn Eng Eng Eng Punct Eng Eng Eng Eng Spn Eng Punct Eng Eng Punct Eng Eng Eng Eng Punct Spn Spn Spn Spn Spn Punct
EnglishTrans: The night is152 just beginning for the neighbors of Mataderos " but an hour-long taxi ride awaits us ( thrill of his life pal conservative " father of " three non-drug taking teens " taxi driver that we have) .
SpanishTrans: La noche está empezando para los vecinos de Mataderos, pero nos espera un viaje en taxi de una hora de duración (la emoción de su vida es la de un conservador, padre de tres adolescentes no drogadictos, taxista que nos ha tocado).

Sentence: From the end of the earth—or at least " the end of Capital Federal—up through all the suburban and sleepy residential barrios that begin with “ Villa " ” dropping off Gaby in Villa Urquiza " and finally back to Palermo .
Tags: Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Punct Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Eng Spn Eng Eng Eng Punct Spn Punct Punct Eng Eng NamedEnt Eng Spn NamedEnt Punct Eng Eng Eng Eng NamedEnt
EnglishTrans: From the end of the earth-or at least " the end of Capital Federal-up through all the suburban and sleepy residential neighborhoods that begin with " Villa " " dropping off Gaby in Villa Urquiza " and finally back to Palermo .
SpanishTrans: Desde el fin del mundo, o al menos "el fin de la Capital Federal", a través de todos los barrios residenciales suburbanos y soñolientos que comienzan con "Villa", dejando a Gaby en Villa Urquiza, y finalmente de vuelta a Palermo.

Sentence: Palermo a secas .
Tags: NamedEnt Spn Spn
EnglishTrans: Just Palermo.
SpanishTrans: Palermo a secas .

Sentence: Our Palermo .
Tags: Eng NamedEnt
EnglishTrans: Our Palermo .
SpanishTrans: Nuestro Palermo.

Sentence: Pero that ride " like they say " es otra historia .
Tags: Spn Eng Eng Punct Eng Eng Eng Punct Spn Spn Spn
EnglishTrans: But that ride "like they say" is another story.
SpanishTrans: Pero ese viaje "como dicen" es otra historia.
